column4: Apparently sendmail has installed itself and runs on startup.  How do I stop it and remove it from startup?  I am very much a novice here.......
sendmail shouldn't be installed by default; ubuntu uses postfix
i wouldn't recommend uninstalling postfix; i think it's needed for local mail delivery
Sorry then.  I assumed it was sendmal.  Then replace sendmail with postifx and same question please..
oh, it shouldn't be listening on any external interfaces
netstat -ant|grep :25 should say this: tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:25            0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN
read the msg ubotu's sent you
afaik that second one is the ipv6 equivalent of the first
Thank you very much.  I appreciate it.
One more question.  It says I should able to apt it but I am getting this :
pls don't paste more than 2 lines
i hope i didn't send such a link
anyway, wget is a general ftp / http client; dpkg is a low-level debian package management tool, and apt-get is a higher-level, repository-aware tool
